name: Avoid Artifacts with too many parameters
description: Avoid artifacts with more than X parameters. The threshold X is a parameter and it can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all artifacts with more than X parameters. It provides the following information:
 Artifact full name, number of parameters
rationale: For maintainability and readability reasons, artifacts should not have too many parameters.
remediation: Review the design of the artifacts to reduce number of parameters.
total: Number of artifacts that have at least 1 parameter
alternativeName: Avoid Artifacts with too many parameters

technicalCriteria.name: Complexity - Algorithmic and Control Structure Complexity

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Excessive Number of Parameters
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-parameterization

Consequence
Software that does not cap the number of parameters degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a number of parameters in its signature that exceeds a threshold value. Default threshold value for the number of parameters is 7.

qualityStandards.name: Poor Code Quality
qualityStandards.description: Code quality issues are fairly prevalent within most mobile code. The good news is that most code quality issues are fairly benign and result in bad programming practice. It is typically difficult to detect these types of issues through manual code review. Instead, attackers will use third-party tools that perform static analysis or perform fuzzing. These types of tools will typically identify memory leaks, buffer overflows, and other less severe issues that result in bad programming practice. Hackers with extreme low-level knowledge and expertise are able to effectively exploit these types of issues. The typical primary goal is to execute foreign code within the mobile code's address space.
